q: What is the maximum number of addressable memory (in English) of a processor that has a 20 bits of address bus lines?
How many memory addresses are needed to store a word of data on 80x86 processor family?
It is a collection of wires on which electrical signals pass between components in the system.
The control bus is an extensive collection of signals that control how the processor communicates with the rest of the system.
For 8086 processor with address bus size of 20, what is the maximum addressable memory?
a word consumes two consecutive memory addresses. Similarly, a double word consumes four consecutive memory locations.
Read operation will transfer the contents of a specific MM location to the CPU. The word in the MM remains unchanged.
The 8088 and 80188 microprocessors have an eight bit data bus. This means that the CPU can transfer 16 bits of data at a time.
This the first sequence of a write memory operation.
opts: CPU sends address of the desired location to the MM, together with the data to be stored into that location.
Data is written at desired location.
CPU sends address of the desired location.
2. MM reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.
a: CPU sends address of the desired location to the MM, together with the data to be stored into that location.

q: To load a word requires two memory operations; to load a double word requires four memory operations in 8088 and 80188 processor.
Write memory operation will transfer a word of information from the CPU to a specific MM location. This overwrites the former contents of that location.
How many bits are there in a one double word of data?
In the Write/Store Cycle the CPU sends address of the desired location to the MM, together with the data to be stored into that location then Data is written at desired location.
In Read/Fetch Cycle: , the CPU sends address of the desired location then the Main Memory reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.
The 8088 and 80188 can manipulate word and double word values, even with their eight bit data bus.
Most computers follow the _________________ Architecture.
In one of the component of CPU, what does MDR means?
In the von neumann architecture the data bus is unidirectional.
It is a CPU component which contains the instruction that is being executed.
The PC (Program Counter) contains the instruction to be executed. During execution, the contents of the PC are updated to point to the next instruction.
It is a conditional Flag that is set to 1 if the low-order 8 bits of the result of the previous operation contain an even number of 1s. Otherwise it is reset to 0.
Perform the operation of the given binary numbers. 0110 0010 1010 0000 - 1001 1101 0110 0000 = 1100 0101 0100 0000 What is the value of AF?
It is a Special Purpose Register that has an extensive collection of one bit values which help determine the current state of the processor. A 16 bits wide register, it uses only nine of those bits.
Perform the operation of the given binary numbers. 0110 0010 1010 0000 - 1001 1101 0110 0000 = 1100 0101 0100 0000 What is the value of CF?
It is a special segment register that contains the program or code.
How many memory addresses are needed to store a double word of data on 80x86 processor family?
It is the number of address lines required to make 1024 memory addressable locations.
The number of bits on the address bus will determine the maximum number of addressable memory and I/O locations (2*n) n- bit binary number.
In the formula (2^n) to determine the maximum addressable memory, what does n stands for?
opts: number of bits of data bus
number of bits of address bus
number of bits of control bus
number of bits of central bus
a: number of bits of address bus

q: This is the second sequence of a write memory operation.
opts: CPU sends address of the desired location to the MM, together with the data to be stored into that location.
MM reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.
Data is written at desired location.
CPU sends address of the desired location.
a: Data is written at desired location.

q: The 8086, 80186, 80286, and 80386sx processors have a 16 bit data bus. This allows these processors to access twice as much memory in the same amount of time as their eight bit brethren.
To access a word at an odd address requires two memory operations (just like the 8088/80188).
Write memory operation will transfer a word of information from the CPU to a specific MM location. This will *not* overwrite the former contents of that location.
How many bits are there in a one word of data?
It is the fourth operating steps between the cpu and memory operations.
opts: The contents of the PC are transferred to the MAR (which are automatically transmitted to the MM) and a Read signal is sent to the MM.
The addressed word is read out of MM and loaded into the MDR.
The contents of MDR are transferred to the IR. The instruction is ready to be decoded and executed.
PC is set to point to the first instruction of the program (the operating system loads the memory address of the first instruction).
a: The contents of MDR are transferred to the IR. The instruction is ready to be decoded and executed.

q: In the von neumann architecture the address bus is unidirectional.
Von Neumann Architecture It is also known as the Stored Program Architecture or the Fetch-Decode-Execute Architecture.
In the von neumann architecture the data bus is bidirectional.
In one of the component of CPU, what does IR means?
It is a conditional Flag that is set to 1 if the result of the previous operation is zero and 0 if the result is nonzero.
Perform the operation of the given binary numbers. 0110 0010 1010 0000 - 1001 1101 0110 0000 = 1100 0101 0100 0000 What is the value of OF?
These are high speed memory elements that resides inside the Central Processing Unit or CPU
Perform the operation of the given binary numbers. 0010 0011 0100 0101 + 0011 0010 0001 1001 What is the value of SF?
The read and write control lines control the direction of data on the data bus.
What is the formula on how to determine the maximum addressable memory and i/o location?
What is the data bus size of pentium family processor?
It is used to select the desired memory or I/O devices by providing a unique address that corresponds to one of the memory or I/O. It is unidirectional.
Accessing 32 bit quantities always takes at least one memory operations on the 16 bit processors.
A word of data will consume two consecutive memory addresses.
How many bits are there in a one byte of data?
It is the first operating steps between the cpu and memory operations.
opts: PC is set to point to the first instruction of the program (the operating system loads the memory address of the first instruction).
The contents of the PC are transferred to the MAR (which are automatically transmitted to the MM) and a Read signal is sent to the MM.
The contents of MDR are transferred to the IR. The instruction is ready to be decoded and executed.
The addressed word is read out of MM and loaded into the MDR
a: PC is set to point to the first instruction of the program (the operating system loads the memory address of the first instruction).

q: In one of the component of CPU, what does MAR means?
It is the third operating steps between the cpu and memory operations.
opts: The addressed word is read out of MM and loaded into the MDR.
The contents of MDR are transferred to the IR. The instruction is ready to be decoded and executed.
The contents of the PC are transferred to the MAR (which are automatically transmitted to the MM) and a Read signal is sent to the MM.
PC is set to point to the first instruction of the program (the operating system loads the memory address of the first instruction).
a: The addressed word is read out of MM and loaded into the MDR.

q: In the von neumann architecture the address bus is bidirectional.

It is a special purpose register that is also the program counter, it contains the memory address of the instruction to be executed.

How many memory addresses are needed to store a one byte of data on 80x86 processor family?
A bus is a collection of wires on which electrical signals pass between components in the system.
It is an extensive collection of signals that control how the processor communicates with the rest of the system.
1 Megabyte is equivalet to ________.
It is a memory operation that transfers the contents of a specific MM location to the CPU. The word in the MM remains unchanged.
This the second sequence of a read memory operation.
opts: Data is written at desired location.
MM reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.
CPU sends address of the desired location.
CPU sends address of the desired location to the MM, together with the data to be stored into that location.
a: MM reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.

q: It is the fifth operating steps between the cpu and memory operations.
opts: The addressed word is read out of MM and loaded into the MDR.
During execution, the contents of the PC are incremented or updated to point to the next instruction.
The contents of MDR are transferred to the IR. The instruction is ready to be decoded and executed.
The contents of the PC are transferred to the MAR (which are automatically transmitted to the MM) and a Read signal is sent to the MM.
a: During execution, the contents of the PC are incremented or updated to point to the next instruction.

MM reads the data stored at that address and sends it to the CPU.

q: The IR ( Instruction Register ) contains the instruction that is being executed.

It is flag register that reflect the result of the previous operation involving the ALU.
It is a conditional Flag in addition that causes this flag to be set to 1 if there is a carry out of the MSB, and a subtraction causes it to be set to 1 if a borrow is needed.

Read operation will transfers the contents of a specific MM location to the CPU. The word in the MM will be changed.

It is a CPU component which holds the address of the location to or from which data are to be transferred.
The IR ( Instruction Register ) contains the address of the instructions that is being executed.

It is a special segment register that contains data referenced by almost all instructions and many addressing modes.

Fetch instruction is an instruction for transferring the data from CPU to main memory.
opts: False, it should be main memory to CPU
False, it should be CPU to accumulator.
False, it should be execute instruction.
a: False, it should be main memory to CPU

q: The PC ( Program Counter ) contains the memory address of the instruction to be executed. During execution, the contents of the PC are updated to point to the next instruction.
It is a general purpose register where most arithmetic and logical computations take place.
Perform the operation of the given binary numbers. 0010 0011 0100 0101 + 0011 0010 0001 1001 What is the value of ZF?
It is a general purpose register that holds the overflow from certain arithmetic operations, and it holds I/O addresses when accessing data on the 80x86 I/O bus.
It is a Control Flags used for a certain type of interrupt (a maskable interrupt) can be recognized by the CPU; otherwise, these interrupts are ignored.
